## Description {#details}

This is an important base class in LLVM.

It provides the common facilities of all constant values in an LLVM program. A constant is a value that is immutable at runtime. Functions are constants because their address is immutable. Same with global variables.

All constants share the capabilities provided in this class. All constants can have a null value. They can have an operand list. Constants can be simple (integer and floating point values), complex (arrays and structures), or expression based (computations yielding a constant value composed of only certain operators and other constant values).

Note that Constants are immutable (once created they never change) and are fully shared by structural equivalence. This means that two structurally equivalent constants will always have the same address. Constants are created on demand as needed and never deleted: thus clients don&#39;t have to worry about the lifetime of the objects. LLVM <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/constant">Constant</a> Representation

Definition at line 42 of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/ir/constant-h">Constant.h</a>.

<EnumerationListItem name="NoRelocation">
This constant requires no relocations (= 0)
</EnumerationListItem>

<Link id="a44ee7542df1c68e8a58bb7f48373e101a35617cff1a6c4d1a44010920ca88c921" />
<EnumerationListItem name="LocalRelocation">
This constant holds static relocations that can be resolved by the static linker (= 1)
</EnumerationListItem>

<Link id="a44ee7542df1c68e8a58bb7f48373e101afe3e07b11719567959fc343102f83ce2" />
<EnumerationListItem name="GlobalRelocation">
This constant holds dynamic relocations that the dynamic linker will need to resolve (= 2)
</EnumerationListItem>

</EnumerationList>

### destroyConstant() {#ae1a4c619a44ea59a2cdeeb85060f385d}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype="void Constant::destroyConstant ()">
Called if some element of this constant is no longer valid.

At this point only other constants may be on the use&#95;list for this constant. <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/any">Any</a> constants on our <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/use">Use</a> list must also be destroy&#39;d. The implementation must be sure to remove the constant from the list of available cached constants. Implementations should implement destroyConstantImpl to remove constants from any pools/maps they are contained it.

Declaration at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/ir/constant-h/#l00169">169</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/ir/constant-h">Constant.h</a>, definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/ir/constants-cpp/#l00489">489</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/ir/constants-cpp">Constants.cpp</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

### handleOperandChange() {#afb784171b976ddd992e3f27ac36a894d}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>void Constant::handleOperandChange (<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/value">Value</a> &#42; From, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/value">Value</a> &#42; To)</>}>
This method is a special form of <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/user/#a1600c7959045cb6b6a5f5a1d427ec67e">User::replaceUsesOfWith</a> (which does not work on constants) that does work on constants.

Update this constant array to change uses of &#39;From&#39; to be uses of &#39;To&#39;.

Basically this method goes through the trouble of building a new constant that is equivalent to the current one, with all uses of From replaced with uses of To. After this construction is completed, all of the users of &#39;this&#39; are replaced to use the new constant, and then &#39;this&#39; is deleted. In general, you should not call this method, instead, use <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/value/#a3ab5fc45117b450e8bb04e564cb6e5f2">Value::replaceAllUsesWith</a>, which automatically dispatches to this method as needed.

This must update the uniquing data structures etc.

Note that we intentionally replace all uses of From with To here. Consider a large array that uses &#39;From&#39; 1000 times. By handling this case all here, <a href="#afb784171b976ddd992e3f27ac36a894d">ConstantArray::handleOperandChange</a> is only invoked once, and that single invocation handles all 1000 uses. Handling them one at a time would work, but would be really slow because it would have to unique each updated array instance.

Declaration at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/ir/constant-h/#l00187">187</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/ir/constant-h">Constant.h</a>, definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/ir/constants-cpp/#l03264">3264</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/ir/constants-cpp">Constants.cpp</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

### removeDeadConstantUsers() {#a960620248182018e566b095f06a605df}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype="void Constant::removeDeadConstantUsers () const">
If there are any dead constant users dangling off of this constant, remove them.

This method is useful for clients that want to check to see if a global is unused, but don&#39;t want to deal with potentially dead constants hanging off of the globals.

Declaration at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/ir/constant-h/#l00204">204</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/ir/constant-h">Constant.h</a>, definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/ir/constants-cpp/#l00739">739</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/ir/constants-cpp">Constants.cpp</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

### toConstantRange() {#a4af4fe6392d3860167eafedc817ed8b1}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype="ConstantRange Constant::toConstantRange () const">
Convert constant to an approximate constant range.

For vectors, the range is the union over the element ranges. Poison elements are ignored.

### mergeUndefsWith() {#a31dbd9cf336966a863e37c5653b6c134}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>Constant &#42; Constant::mergeUndefsWith (<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/constant">Constant</a> &#42; C, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/constant">Constant</a> &#42; Other)</>}
  labels = {["static"]}>
Merges undefs of a <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/constant">Constant</a> with another <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/constant">Constant</a>, along with the undefs already present.

Other doesn&#39;t have to be the same type as C, but both must either be scalars or vectors with the same element count. If no changes are made, the constant C is returned.

Declaration at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/ir/constant-h/#l00235">235</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/ir/constant-h">Constant.h</a>, definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/ir/constants-cpp/#l00808">808</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/ir/constants-cpp">Constants.cpp</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

  labels = {["static"]}>
Try to replace undefined constant C or undefined elements in C with Replacement.

If no changes are made, the constant C is returned.
